alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 1:24PM CDT until May 21 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 40.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 41.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 130 PM CDT.
